importantDates.descriptionOfWhyDateIsRelevant: The outage occurred at 07:11 GMT on Monday, October 20, 2025, marking the start time of the AWS service disruption that affected global digital services.
By 10:11 GMT on the same day, AWS reported full restoration of services, indicating the duration and resolution timeline of the incident.

importantTimeframes.descriptionOfWhyTimeFrameIsRelevant: The outage lasted approximately three hours, beginning at 07:11 GMT and resolving by 10:11 GMT, during which 113 AWS services were impacted.

keyTakeAways: The AWS outage was caused by a technical error during an API update to DynamoDB, which disrupted the Domain Name System (DNS), preventing apps from connecting to the correct server addresses.
The root cause was human error, not a cyberattack or malicious activity, as confirmed by cybersecurity expert Bryson Bort of Scythe.

The outage affected 113 AWS services and impacted major platforms such as Snapchat, Pinterest, WhatsApp, Zoom, Roblox, Fortnite, Apple TV, Starbucks, Duolingo, Canva, and financial apps like Venmo and Coinbase.
The incident highlighted the critical dependency of modern digital life—banking, gaming, communication, e-commerce, smart home devices, and media platforms—on cloud infrastructure.
AWS is the world’s largest cloud service provider, holding a 30% market share, and the incident demonstrated how deeply embedded its services are in global operations.
Despite the widespread disruption, AWS reported a rapid recovery, with engineers working on multiple recovery paths and full restoration by 10:11 GMT.

summaryOfNewsArticle: A major AWS outage on Monday, October 20, 2025, began at 07:11 GMT and lasted until 10:11 GMT, affecting 113 services and disrupting apps such as Snapchat, WhatsApp, Zoom, Roblox, Fortnite, financial platforms like Venmo and Coinbase, media companies like The New York Times, and smart home devices including Ring and Alexa. The root cause was a human error during a technical update to DynamoDB’s API, which disrupted the Domain Name System (DNS), preventing apps from connecting to servers. Despite the wide-ranging impact, AWS engineers resolved the issue quickly, and the company confirmed it was not a cyberattack. The event underscores the critical role of cloud computing in modern digital life, with AWS being the dominant provider and deeply embedded in global technology ecosystems.
title: What caused Amazon’s AWS outage, and why did so many major apps go offline?
